meanings.definition: The act of making something or someone German in character or nationality.
meanings.sent1: The germanization of the restaurant's menu included traditional German dishes.
meanings.sent2: The germanization of the immigrant community was evident in their celebrations of Oktoberfest.
meanings.sent3: The germanization of the penguin colony led to them wearing tiny lederhosen.
meanings.sent4: The germanization of the town spread like wildfire, transforming it into a little Bavaria.
meanings.sent5: The germanization of the music festival brought in polka bands and beer gardens.

meanings.definition: The process of imposing German culture or language on a non-German population.
meanings.sent1: The germanization of the school curriculum introduced German language classes to all students.
meanings.sent2: The germanization of the region resulted in the adoption of German customs and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The germanization of the zoo involved teaching the animals to respond to commands in German.
meanings.sent4: The germanization of the neighborhood changed the street signs to German names.
meanings.sent5: The germanization of the workplace led to the introduction of German holidays and traditions.
